question_text: A 47-year-old woman has a chronic skin condition involving the extensor surfaces of her knees, elbows, sacrum, and scalp.Representative lesions are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: Psoriasis vulgaris (Option C) is most commonly characterized by sharply marginated plaques with a thick, adherent, silvery scale. Psoriasis has a predilection for the extensor areas of the elbows, knees, presacral skin, and scalp, as seen in this patient. Nail changes may include pitting, nail plate thickening and distal crumbling, separation of the nail plate from the nail bed, and splinter hemorrhages. The disease can be limited or widespread.
